672793059.name: Interesting & Historical Place to visit!
672793059.author: a TripAdvisor user
672793059.reviewBody: Ever since I found out about Chetumal I wanted to visit, and I found a lot more than what I expected.   People around the whole Quintana Roo area are very hospitable, and willing to go the extra miles to help. Love the energy of the town, very interesting to be on that part of the country and listen to the locals and their town stories. It is also a safe place to go with your family. While in there you have to try their local dessert named La Marquesita, and the Machado. The seafood is very tasty, and we were so lucky that they have a fair going on while we were in town so it made our visit more enjoyable.

668482573.name: Wonderful protected area
668482573.author: a TripAdvisor user
668482573.reviewBody: A real treasure along the long waterfront of Chetumal.  Great area for walking, running, bicycling, playing, birding, or just relaxing. The nicest natural space a city could have.

663711397.name: Fun Walk Especially in the Evening
663711397.author: a TripAdvisor user
663711397.reviewBody: After we ate dinner last night, we walked back to our hotel and walked almost 1/2 mile along here from Sam\u2019s Club on.  It was so beautiful and entertaining.  Lots of food trucks, all selling something delicious though we had just eaten and didn\u2019t buy anything.  Kids around the statue in battery-powered cars, just people strolling and then we walked in on a spanish dance lesson!  Kids on a stag learning native Mexican dances from the ages of, I would say 5-15.  Lots of parents sitting on the benches watching and the kids were obviously having fun.  Great teacher, too.  He was fun and energized.  Why don\u2019t kids in the US have dance lessons that they can use for a lifelong time?  One parent couple even got up and danced behind the rest of the kids and you could tell, they had taken the class years ago!  FUN TIME on the Malecon de Chetumal!

651898292.name: Nice walk
651898292.author: a TripAdvisor user
651898292.reviewBody: Really nice to walk on the seaside. Obviously forget to look into cristal clear water, it\u2019a a lagoon. But in the day, as in the night, is nice to pass here.

647046659.name: Nice View
647046659.author: a TripAdvisor user
647046659.reviewBody: Jogged along the Malecon. Flat and near the water but the pavers are uneven. Very easy to trip. Locals seem to use the road, if thsst is any indication.

644851181.name: nice stroll
644851181.author: a TripAdvisor user
644851181.reviewBody: it\'s a nice evening stroll all along the local Malecon. this is not Havanna, but it is still peasant - and has much less traffic then its bigger brother. lots of monuments and some restaurants along, but also some benches or just the wall to sit and enjoy.

629210076.name: Views of the bay and more
629210076.author: a TripAdvisor user
629210076.reviewBody: Great place for an evening stroll as specialy on the weekends when the street is crowded with food venders. Best Chorros ever and Icecream stuffed pancakes, Yum!!

623586083.name: It\'s a sign on the Malecon
623586083.author: a TripAdvisor user
623586083.reviewBody: Unlike the Cancun one there is no queue. Nice setting with the fisherman statue behind it. Good location to walk either up or down the Malecon

610862958.name: Nice place to stay
610862958.author: a TripAdvisor user
610862958.reviewBody: No many thing to do there, nice to walk and try the local fast food, good yummys and lots of local people, it is a good place to stay a while with friends.

609524984.name: Average, not great
609524984.author: a TripAdvisor user
609524984.reviewBody: We went down around noon-ish, and there was practically none of the night-life open that other reviews talk about. One or two small stalls selling cold drinks, that was it. The sign itself is, well, a sign. Take your picture, and you\'re basically done. \n\nOn the other hand, Chetumal isn\'t a hotbed of tourism, and the sign is close to the ferry terminal (very easily walkable), so it\'s worth a stroll if you\'re travelling through,

584382060.name: Nice malecon
584382060.author: a TripAdvisor user
584382060.reviewBody: Not much to do, very hot and humid.\nStill the "aqui nacio mexico" Is very nice sign with the statue next to it, the clock and the sea view.

576972442.name: a pleasant walk
576972442.author: a TripAdvisor user
576972442.reviewBody: The malecon in Chetumal runs for a fair distance along the rocky shore of the Atlantic Ocean, There are hotels & restaurants on the non beach side, it is a pleasant walk with a nice breeze on hot days, but little else.

572005145.name: not much to do or see
572005145.author: a TripAdvisor user
572005145.reviewBody: Carts with unhealthy food, some rusty kiddie rides, a few trinket stalls, and a busy road,that\'s about it.

569957093.name: Walk at Sunset
569957093.author: a TripAdvisor user
569957093.reviewBody: I recommend to walk at sunset because the weather is better than mid-day. It\'s a big path, but you can find a lot of life in some kilometers start in front of Governmental Palace to billboard "Aqu\u00ed inicia M\u00e9xico". In these kilometers, you will find a lot of local food (try a "Machacado"), drinks and enterteiment. Other parts of the path has restaurants and bars.

557734969.name: Uninspiring Malecon
557734969.author: a TripAdvisor user
557734969.reviewBody: We walked for half an hour along the Malecon by the ferry terminal on a very quiet day, some areas had a very unpleasant odour and the area was very unattractive.

556367352.name: A lovely place to walk and enjoy the day!
556367352.author: a TripAdvisor user
556367352.reviewBody: Located right on the Bay of Chetumal, it is a very nice place to get your morning walk in or an evening stroll to watch the sunset. Very clean and safe area.

548068155.name: Quiet ocean views
548068155.author: a TripAdvisor user
548068155.reviewBody: This is a nice relaxing spot near downtown Chetumal. Across from the government palace is a great spot to take some photos, as it is frequently not crowded.

540966747.name: A Must!
540966747.author: a TripAdvisor user
540966747.reviewBody: The malecon is definitely somewhere to visit when in Chetumal. Not only will you be right on the sea side but there are a few restaurants along it and even a park with a really high slide into the water. Be careful, however, as the sea wall is not high so unattended kids could easily fall in. The malecon is especially great at night, as there are countless little carts selling stuff like churros, machacadas, juices and marquesitas. It is a nice place when you are looking to take your kids for a little evening stroll.

504456343.name: Looking at Belize
504456343.author: a TripAdvisor user
504456343.reviewBody: The Malecon in Chetumal is simple and you can have a stroll with ocean view. There is pretty much nothing else to see in Chetumal. This city is not exactly a touristic hotspot :)

501304792.name: Nice place to take pictures
501304792.author: a TripAdvisor user
501304792.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place to take pics and hang out with the family, it was very humid and the middle of the day when we went SO I highly recommend visit this place later afternoon to hangout but overall I like it, was nice to see where Mexico Begins \ud83d\ude01

500093638.name: Nice at dawn
500093638.author: a TripAdvisor user
500093638.reviewBody: Is a long water front , with parks, biciclet acces, food cars, and family friendly enviromet, a must in this city, a small city

499199886.name: Nice walk
499199886.author: a TripAdvisor user
499199886.reviewBody: We stopped at El Malecon, very nice but windy, the water seemed choppy. It was a nice place to stop and relax and just enjoy the breeze.

478083632.name: Nice drive or walk
478083632.author: a TripAdvisor user
478083632.reviewBody: We made a very nice drive along the whole malecon. It\'s a long drive. We just drive and stop to see the views and monuments.

477295971.name: Stopover
477295971.author: a TripAdvisor user
477295971.reviewBody: Nice comfortable walking area. Many families use the Malec\u00f3n for evening strolls. Very safe and a good place to find a restaurant

472788094.name: Local Mexican food
472788094.author: a TripAdvisor user
472788094.reviewBody: We loved it, especially in the night. Great place to visit with children , is safe and fun. Trampolines everywhere, also Atvs for 20 pesos for 5 minutes, we had a great time, go for churros, sausages and fries!

458789804.name: Good photo opp!
458789804.author: a TripAdvisor user
458789804.reviewBody: Nothing really special just a sign that says Chetumal. Good place to take a picture and hang out and enjoy some sea breeze. At night there are vendors selling snacks

444240652.name: Makes for a great seaside stroll on a warm day
444240652.author: a TripAdvisor user
444240652.reviewBody: We came here to get away from the congestion of downtown Chetumal and were very delighted at the spacious and laid back atmosphere of the Malecon. Parts of it appear to be a bit rundown as some of the bars and clubs have closed over the years, but overall it remains a great place to unwind while taking a walk alone or with friends.

442738859.name: Malecons!
442738859.author: a TripAdvisor user
442738859.reviewBody: I\'m a sucker for malecons. If a city has one, I\'m there. Walked along during the night, lots of vendors selling marquesitas, which you should definitely tried. One of the weirdest things I ate in Mexico.

436137618.name: behind our hotel
436137618.author: a TripAdvisor user
436137618.reviewBody: nice walk, beautiful view,  food for sale right there. Sames was less than 5 minutes walk. I also think there was a club on the boardwalk

428995520.name: Don\'t miss evenings along the Chetumal malec\u00f3n
428995520.author: a TripAdvisor user
428995520.reviewBody: When the weather is hot during the day, you can find families swimming in the bay at various points along the malec\u00f3n but, when the sun goes down, it gets much more interesting. Park your car near the Italian Coffee Company and head south. Stop and rent a bicycle for 20 pesos an hour and pedal along enjoying the cooler evening air. Stop and treat yourself to a marquesita.

421548006.name: Not much to see
421548006.author: a TripAdvisor user
421548006.reviewBody: A bit boring, old and not much to see here. Its okay if you want to walk and look at the waterfront.

421196979.name: Loves strolling Chetumal!
421196979.author: a TripAdvisor user
421196979.reviewBody: Beautiful waterfront for a lovely evening walk.  Clean, safe and friendly.  There are many nice restaurants to select.  I chose Almina for dinner.  It was divine.

397251040.name: Nice walk near the sea - must see spot in Chetumal
397251040.author: a TripAdvisor user
397251040.reviewBody: I loved afternoon and morning walk on the malecon. During the afternoon you will see many food trucks selling sweet or salty Mexican delicacies and many people will walk around. Mornings are more quite but still very nice and safe to walk.\nDo not miss big sign of the Chetumal where Mexico begins. As well, if you will be lucky, maybe you see Larry the crocodile and manatee (I was not so lucky).\nThis is definatelly one of the spots to see in Chetumal

382460893.name: Sad, neglected seawall
382460893.author: a TripAdvisor user
382460893.reviewBody: This place is really run down and clearly has seen better days. The bay is completely contaminated and not safe to swim in. The stench of raw sewage was unbearable. It\'s really sad that the locals don\'t take care of the environment. Nothing worth seeing here. An utter waste of time!

375130251.name: Good place!!!
375130251.author: a TripAdvisor user
375130251.reviewBody: Nice place to relax, to walk and even workout. It\'s a safe and Pacific  place. I definitely recommend it.

656780310.name: Such a great alternative to all the well know places
656780310.author: a TripAdvisor user
656780310.reviewBody: We arrived early (08:00 AM), which I recommend for every archaeological site. They are all opening at 08:00 AM. The area is bigger than Tulum, but smaller than Coba, mostly shaded and a lovely experience. We saw monkeys and it was beautiful to climb the stairs of these ancient structures. I highly recommend to hire a local guide and get to know the history of the area. It does make a huge difference when you get to learn about these impressive buildings. Be aware about bigger groups arriving later the morning due to the cruise ships arriving at Puerto Maya, so best time to visit is either early in the morning or late afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

645203690.name: nice and interesting
645203690.author: a TripAdvisor user
645203690.reviewBody: we liked Kohunlich more then Dzibanche, visiting both sites by taxi from Chetumal. Leaving at 8 AM, we were back in town by 3 PM. the taxi charged us 1000 Peso, and he deserved a tipp. Kohunlich is closer to the main road and we visited it first, before bigger tourist groups made their way here. and we really enjoyed the quited place very much.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

644314161.name: Amazing
644314161.author: a TripAdvisor user
644314161.reviewBody: This is the third time that I have visited this Maya site no too far from the city of Chetumal. The last time I visited Kohunlich was approximately 35 years ago and boy has it changed! At that tome the main attraction was only the pyramid with the "masks" but today many more temples have been restored which make this site even more attractive to visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

639794698.name: Great visit
639794698.author: a TripAdvisor user
639794698.reviewBody: Visited Kohunlich as part of shore excursion. Located in the jungle Mayan city was absolutely perfect place to visit. Recommend it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

637858574.name: Yet another great Mayan ruins
637858574.author: a TripAdvisor user
637858574.reviewBody: Quite place, with big green spaces between the pyramids you can climb onto, giving you another view of the jungle, shame it isn\'t more visited or catered for more visitors, I .e lack of souvenirs or drinks stalls, just toilets next to ticket desk, but just two miles away is a great bar/restaurant, The Explorean by Kohunlich.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

613500389.name: Jungle ruins
613500389.author: a TripAdvisor user
613500389.reviewBody:
We booked a double tour ( this Dzibanche) and this site made you feel like you were deep in the jungle with the extremely dense and exotic vexation that engulfed its boundaries.  

The archeological site itself was the more polished of the two and offered a wide variety of structures to explore.

The primary notable features here are the elaborate masks (very large)carved into the structure of one the pyramids... they are fantastic.  This site also holds one the courts for the Mayan ball game that fascinates so many people.

A great place to visit in the late afternoon when the lower angle of the sun offers more shaded areas and better lighting for pictures.

We would go back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

604391897.name: Must see!
604391897.author: a TripAdvisor user
604391897.reviewBody: The ruins are a must see because they aren\'t as crowed as some of the other Mayan ruins. That being said you don\'t have the luxury of having a place to buy drinks, snacks, souvenirs, or really a place to use the restroom. But if you like seeing all the ruins, this has been my favorite out of the five or so that I\'ve been too!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

588549442.name: Maya Ruins Worth the Ride
588549442.author: a TripAdvisor user
588549442.reviewBody:
We booked this excursion online through The Native Choice - a great choice for us. There were only 4 of us! plus a driver and an excellent guide who took great care of us. The ride was nearly an hour but our native Costa Rican guide delighted us with history, geography and culture both going and returning. 
  The ruins are impressive especially the carved masks. Our guide explained what the different buildings were used for. In the sports court he dispelled the myth about the winning team being sacrificed. 
  Expect to do a fair amount of walking. We didn't have problems with insects but it could be very warm there.
  Native Choice provided a sack lunch and beverages including water. Another plus was the quick stop at a village to buy ready-to-eat honey pineapple. We enjoyed the pineapple so much we asked to stop and pick up more for snacking on the way back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

586798374.name: Interesting mayan ruins
586798374.author: a TripAdvisor user
586798374.reviewBody: This is a place with mayan ruins , with a lot of piramids,  juego de pelota maya, and a lot of mascarones, big mayan masks, in the middle of the jungle

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

572967995.name: Very interesting ruins
572967995.author: a TripAdvisor user
572967995.reviewBody:
We went on a tour that including Dzibanche and Kohunlich.  The two sites are about 35 minutes apart.  Seeing the two together made for a very interesting day as they each have their interesting aspects.  We did this as a day excursion while on a cruise that stopped at Costa Maya.  You spend a couple of hours on the bus each way and get about an hour at each location.

According to our guide (and my memory!), the ruins at Dzibanche include more ritual areas.  They were pyramids used as part of religious activities.  It includes several pyramids that you can climb to look around and a few include interesting carvings.  I had previously been to San Gervaiso which includes much smaller ruins.  Being able to climb these tall pyramids provided an interesting view and perspective on the impressive architecture of the Mayans.

The ruins at Kohunlich cover a wider area and include more aspects of Mayan life.  They include residences, offices, religious activities, etc.  There is also a pyramid there that is named the Temple of the Masks and you get a great view of masks that were carved into the rock.  Walking around Kohunlich gives you more of a feel for what it must have been like for a Mayan person to walk around a town that they had built.

Together our group of tweens to adults found the sites very impressive and we thoroughly enjoyed the day.  We felt it was well worth the bus ride.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

568479369.name: Day Trip from Bacalar
568479369.author: a TripAdvisor user
568479369.reviewBody: We drove ourselves here from Bacalar and were suprised to find tour buses already at the complex.  The tours are super short (in time) and only seem to touch on the central buildings around the plaza.  We like to wander and get a bit off the beaten path, and there is a well-shaded (important on hot days!) back around the back of the ruins.  Two different tour groups came and went while we were there and didn\'t bother our peaceful day of exploration.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

563328998.name: Really great day trip to see well-preserved ruins in a quiet setting
563328998.author: a TripAdvisor user
563328998.reviewBody:
We visited Kohunlich from Chetumal, driving our own vehicle rather than taking a tour. Seeing the ruins this way is highly recommended, as you can avoid the tour buses and tour groups and set your own schedule. 
The ruins are about an hour from Chetumal, well-signed on the highway. The roads are good all the way, with the last little bit on a paved but narrow road from the highways. A few potholes but nothing serious, and we had to slow down and pull over to let a tour bus pass. 
We arrived about 9:30 in the morning, and I think if we had been an hour earlier we would have have the ruins all to ourselves! Entry fee as of Feb 2018 is 70 pesos per person. 
At the entrance is a ticket booth and a washroom with flush toilets. NO food, NO amenities. And also NO touts or sellers (hooray!) This site really does just have the ruins. 
There is a map at the ticket booth, recommend taking a photo of it so you can follow the recommended path through the site. Buildings have plaques with short explanations on them in Spanish and English (some are very brief). 
You can climb pretty much all over everything and explore - dangerous places are roped off. 
The key attraction at this site is the temple of the masks at the very back of the site (that's where the tour that beat us spent most of their time with the guide). You can climb up the steps in the middle, with the huge mask carvings on either side. The carvings are roped off and protected by palapa roofs. They're fantastically preserved and very impressive. 
The other most impressive structure on the site is the 27 steps, with (naturally) lots of steps, turrets, rounded stone corners, and plazas. 
The site has quite a bit of shade, but we recommend taking sunblock and bug spray with you. Take a bottle of water with you, and maybe a snack, as there aren't any shops once you arrive at the site. 
Overall an impressive, quiet, Mayan site with some unique features. Easy to get to by car, well worth a visit if you're exploring the southern Yucatan. 

Give this review a helpful vote if you found this it helpful.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

561323612.name: Great experience!
561323612.author: a TripAdvisor user
561323612.reviewBody: This archeological site is spectacular. The ruins have been very well preserved and well maintained. There is very little more than just the ruins but it is so awesome that it doesn\'t matter. Our guide was excellent. He was of Mayan descent and gave us a wonderful background of his ancient ancestors. Over-the-top great! His description at each building was very informative. These ruins are well worth the 2+ hours from Costa R]Maya Port.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal 186

672797020.name: Simple but valuable place to visit while in Chetumal.
672797020.author: a TripAdvisor user
672797020.reviewBody: I found out about this ruins by coincidence, but I am very grateful we went.  You really need a car to visit the ruins because there is no public transportation.  We took a local taxi, and we were lucky enough to have someone very nice and knowledgeable about Chetumal history. We hire him for a round trip to the ruins.  YOU MUST BRING YOUR MOSQUITOES REPELLENT, they are no joke! it is a very simple place but full of history, and if you concentrate enough you can feel the energy of the place as well. On our way back we stop at  La Calderitas to eat at one of the local restaurant, and the food was really good, we have such as a good time during our visit thru out  the Rivera Maya. You have to pay an entrance fee of $42 Mexican pesos per person. Hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM. We went on a Saturday and it was hardly few people along the path. The ruins received this name from the great amount of Ramon trees (ox in Mayan) that surround the site.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

572007013.name: Small but very nice
572007013.author: a TripAdvisor user
572007013.reviewBody: We stumbled on this after a boat ride to Tamalcab and were nicely surprised. Small but very pretty. And my kids were thrilled by a friendly puppy hanging around the entrance.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

567257626.name: Oxtankah
567257626.author: a TripAdvisor user
567257626.reviewBody:
Driver beware: the last 1 km of the way is a dirt road with pits, stones and boulders, and dried stream beds from torrential tropical rains. It's still negotiable even by a small car but our little Hyundai was really struggling there. Other than that the site is good. It doesn't have much to offer in comparison to other sites yet it has nice piece of a frieze containing remnants of original red pigment and a few burial sites (they put imitation skeletons in situ).     
 
 
OT: I stopped writing reviews on TA since past summer as TA editors, being the morons that they are, deleted some of my reviews for not adhering to their standards even though some of those reviews were marked as helpful by other TA readers. But of course TA editors in their infinite wisdom know better what's helpful. So from now on I will write reviews only when I think the info may be important and helpful to other members. Sorry for making you reading my rant.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

425386026.name: Bautiful
425386026.author: a TripAdvisor user
425386026.reviewBody: Beautiful and nice place is so amazing not so many people since tavelers think that chetumal has nothing to offer and just use for tansit between Belize and Mexico pople should stay at last 2 days in Chetumal.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

421193177.name: Fabulous site!
421193177.author: a TripAdvisor user
421193177.reviewBody: This Maya site is a must see for archaeology lovers who are visiting the Chetumal area.  The site is very well maintained by INAH.  It has well groomed trails so the walk is very easy.  The most beautiful stucco remains can be found here.  Allow two hours to visit the site to leisurely enjoy the city.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

356326150.name: It was OK !!!
356326150.author: a TripAdvisor user
356326150.reviewBody: it was a nice visit i liked all the ruins and the explanation it had was great and the long walk is so nice. Wish it had at least a guide to explain about it more and inform about the mosquitoes...that was the only bad experience apart from that i loved it great area to cover with walking and adventurous....

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

245785433.name: Not worth it.
245785433.author: a TripAdvisor user
245785433.reviewBody: Even if you have *enough* time, don\'t even bother. It\'s not worth it. You\'ll probably still find it in your heart to appreciate the minor ruins, sure. But the place is clearly poorly maintained. No tour guides. No proper warnings to put repellent first - the place is actually being taken over by mosquitoes/insects, yikes! Waste of time, money and energy.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

201593633.name: Some very minor ruins indeed...
201593633.author: a TripAdvisor user
201593633.reviewBody: If you\'re in the Chetumal area, the Oxtankah ruins, which are only a few miles north of town, might be of interest, even though the ruins themselves are not all that impressive. They are situated in a very well-kept park and should not take more than an hour to visit. There is an interesting ruin of a Spanish chapel built right among the Mayan ruins, using stones from the Mayan buildings. Quite a contrast! On my visit, there was a team of archaeologists and their Mexican laborers working on the ruins. It was fascinating to watch the meticulous care with which the workers scrubbed away at the dirt to reveal a cut stone or other piece of the building.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

193061569.name: Uncrowed-Well Worth Seeing
193061569.author: a TripAdvisor user
193061569.reviewBody: A short distance from Calderitas. Cab fare should be 40 to 50 pesos. Don\'t let them try to charge you 100. These pyramids are not considered really important due to lack of religious or government structures. Still, it is an easy and interesting site to visit. Go in the morning. No one there.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

160830347.name: Really interesting!
160830347.author: a TripAdvisor user
160830347.reviewBody: This place is not in Campeche, but in the State of Quintana Roo, near the capital Chetumal\nIt has one of the most amazing structures mande by Spaniards, a Church next to the Mayan temples. It is something you need to see, how they started collection the stones from the Temples to build a different temple. There is a small museum with an explanation. Calderitas beach is just 10 minutes away and Chetumal City just 30 minutes away.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

151419925.name: A little visited sight
151419925.author: a TripAdvisor user
151419925.reviewBody: I took a taxi from Chetumal to the ruins at a cost of 300 pesos.  I went early in the morning to avoid the heat and humidity that an afternoon visit would have brought.  There was a stucco mask under a palapa as well as an excavation with some of the original colors under a palapa.  The pyramids are not tall, but you can climb them.  One of the pyramids has special features that was open to the public (the gate was unlocked and open).  The site is well worth the 42 peso entry fee.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

145851301.name: Temples and Church in Coastal Forest
145851301.author: a TripAdvisor user
145851301.reviewBody: Oxtankah is reached by taking the road to Calderitas north of Chetumal, then driving 6 kilometers on a smaller road to the ruins. There is a nice shady pathway that winds around the ruins with several plants and trees named on signs. The ruins consist of a small pyramid, a Spanish mission church and several small structures but several structures were being excavated and rebuilt so it may get better. Had a one room museum. We saw a lot of birds. Few visitors. Cost was 42 pesos with free parking at the entrance. Toilets but no refreshments.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

140695521.name: if you\'re in Chetumal, worth an hour or two
140695521.author: a TripAdvisor user
140695521.reviewBody: On our 2012 trip we used Chetumal as our home base for a couple days. One afternoon, looking for something to do, we ate at a bayside seafood restaurant in the northern resort suburb of Calderitas and then explored Oxtankah ruins, not far north. The ruins themselves were fairly low-dkey, but the setting in a dense coastal forest added a lot to the experience. This location is quite close to the bay, so it\'s very humid, but the abundant large trees keep the sun at bay.

address.streetAddress: Calderitas

644850972.name: great thing, but nothing to see
644850972.author: a TripAdvisor user
644850972.reviewBody: it\'s definitely a great thing to have the Manati protected and the whole bay of Chetumal considered a sanctuary for this rare animal. but dont expect to see one here. this is not a zoo, just a large bay.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

561288761.name: Closed on Sundays.
561288761.author: a TripAdvisor user
561288761.reviewBody: Hard to give a rating as it was closed on the day (Sunday) we went. \nPleasant area about 20 to 30 minutes north of Chetumal.\nWill try again next time we visit the area.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

534648546.name: Amazing! But watch it, it\'s not a zoo!!
534648546.author: a TripAdvisor user
534648546.reviewBody: If you love these animals you will be amazed by this place wich is a sanctuary for the manathes. They come and go all the time because it is their natural enviroment. I were really pleased to see that local people living there take good care of them and the lagoon. We have to remeber that this is not a Zoo and the animals here are always in motion and it is likely that you may not see them, but if you are lucky enough to see or even feed this incredible creatures, be thankfull and treasure the moment, remember that they are an endangered espices and need support. That is why what this guys do at de sanctuary is an amazing job!!

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

511592952.name: Danny where you at though?
511592952.author: a TripAdvisor user
511592952.reviewBody: I heard rumours of Danny\'s majestic flippers in Tulum, so I knew I had to visit Chetumal. Danny didn\'t show up, but I saw a signpost with a photo of Danny, so I took it as a success.\nGood luck Danny, may your three thick lips guide you.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

500093951.name: 10 if you ar\u00e9 a sincere animal lover
500093951.author: a TripAdvisor user
500093951.reviewBody: Nice place to go and to improve your knolege, But for me that it,  almost the same of another that i went a few years before

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

431522315.name: Nothing to see
431522315.author: a TripAdvisor user
431522315.reviewBody: Much better places to watch Manatees and also some other better attractions in Chetumal.\n\nIt is at the end of the Malecon, but you have to walk some distance with out any interesting to see.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

355167129.name: Remodeling
355167129.author: a TripAdvisor user
355167129.reviewBody: We drove more than 30 km from downtown Chetumal to see Daniel, and the place was closed, the person there told us that he came to eat at 9 am but didnt showed up for lunch at 12 pm, and the place is closed because they are making this area in Latuna Guerrero for the tourists, i guess daniel wont be coming back for that, since he is a free manateee, that comes and goes, and manatee hate people around!

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

349989652.name: Visiting Danny
349989652.author: a TripAdvisor user
349989652.reviewBody: Awesome experience. We got lucky and a university professor that has been working with Danny since he was a baby happened to be there when we arrived. He explained to us all about Danny\'s story and about both manatee\'s in the local area and around the world. Really awesome experience and amazingly just donation based. The money you donate goes back into upkeep of the sanctuary and delicious veggie snacks for Danny. He\'s such a curious and friendly animal. But best of all is great to see that he is free to come and go whenever he pleases and not caged up like the \'swim with dolphins\'/dolphinariums (AKA dolphin prisons) you see scattered all over the Riviera Maya. He tends to be there a lot during the day and then heads back into the lagoon in the evenings - but hey who wouldn\'t show up for a free meal?

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

262983792.name: Up Close Visit with a Manatee
262983792.author: a TripAdvisor user
262983792.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our visit here.  Daniel was found alone as a newborn manatee with his umbical cord still attached.  We have been told that he was bottle-fed and raised by humans and now comes into the sanctuary during the day and leaves in the evenings and is "libre".  There is no charge for this attraction, but any donations go to help for the care and food for Danny the Manatee.  The gentleman that guided our visit with Danny was very helpful.  A great attraction for families.  If you continue a little further down the road, there is a brige with a nice spillway where people were swimming.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

197906435.name: Visisted Danny the Manatee
197906435.author: a TripAdvisor user
197906435.reviewBody: We saw "Danny" the sole manatee who still lives in the sanctuary\'s pens. It was not clear why the manatees were released. Danny and various fish choose to hang around the sanctuary for the free lunch. The taxi ride was 150 pesos from downtown chetumal. The sanctuary was locked when we arrived. A couple of children unlocked the gate and let us in to see the manatee. The young girl was very enthusiastic and told us lots about the manatees in spanish. Admittance is free of charge; any money donated goes to buy more lettuce for Danny. A local told us 4-5km further up the road there was a viewing tower to see the rest of the manatees in the laguna. We did not go any further to check that out.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

176532338.name: Very interesting and informarive!
176532338.author: a TripAdvisor user
176532338.reviewBody: How lucky-  we got there on 7th of September - the National Manatee day! We didn\'t know one existed! So there was music and dances. Daniel, the manatee was happy and friendly. The staff were very informative - told us all kind of inetersting facts about manatees, their habitat. Daniel is a free manatee who chooses to come and feed at the sanctuary which is great as there are not too many places like that! We didn\'t have to pay anything for entrance too.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

167854998.name: A very nice experience
167854998.author: a TripAdvisor user
167854998.reviewBody: We were in chetumal and decided to go visit the santuario del Manati. It was fairly easy to find a taxi to take us there and the cost was ok. When we arrived we discovered that it is closed on mondays but the taxi driver found the care taker and we were able to enter any way. Facinating creatures and impressive that they are free but come to get dinner when called for.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

157608247.name: 100% recommended
157608247.author: a TripAdvisor user
157608247.reviewBody: I\'m lucky too be there! to find the Manatee sanctuary all over the coast, prohibited take pix but you need to be there! to have a view of them, seen them at many places just close to there beautiful Bay of Chetumal.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

11264135.name: An amazing experience in Chetumal
11264135.author: a TripAdvisor user
11264135.reviewBody: You have the posibility of feed a real manatee, and know different protected species in this area, located near the Chetumal City. The tour operator Uchben Kah Tours has a guided tour, you can visit the web site for more information.

address.streetAddress: Bahia de Chetumal

668481660.name: Great local museum
668481660.author: a TripAdvisor user
668481660.reviewBody: Innovative small museum with insightful & informative exhibits.  Well designed, interesting for everyone.  It\'s a limited museum but tells the amazing story of the Mayan civilization and its culture.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

667664007.name: Take the time
667664007.author: a TripAdvisor user
667664007.reviewBody: This exhibit is very well done and really interesting.  It is close to the city centre so easy to get to.  Well worth your time if you are interested in history or are looking for something to do.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

653594315.name: Like this spot!!
653594315.author: a TripAdvisor user
653594315.reviewBody: This was a nice spot to visit, love museums and cultural visits.  Lots to see with really nice folks!

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

651452908.name: Worth a visit
651452908.author: a TripAdvisor user
651452908.reviewBody: This is a nice, small museum. The exhibits have good explanations in both English & Spanish. The interior architecture consists of a series of ramps & platforms that allow for a wide perspective of some of the exhibits. One exhibit I especially liked was a copy of a mural from Bonampak. Entrance fee for foreigners is MX100. I recommend bringing a flashlight to read the descriptions because the interior appears to be purposely kept with low light.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

651269306.name: Mayan Musuem
651269306.author: a TripAdvisor user
651269306.reviewBody: This is a good small museum, which they are expanding. It also has an archllogical walking  area which we missed the last time we were here. Very easy to get to by bus.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

647046872.name: Well Done
647046872.author: a TripAdvisor user
647046872.reviewBody: If you are interested in the Mayan story this is the place. Short on artefacts but the displays and written material are very informative.\n101 pesos. How do they come up with these odd numbers?

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

644985915.name: educational, but artificial
644985915.author: a TripAdvisor user
644985915.reviewBody: artificial trees and plants, artificial sounds of birds and jaguars, artificial replicas and miniaturas... a good place for children to learn about the Maya history, but not for people looking for real artefacts.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

611756724.name: Wonderful History Experience!
611756724.author: a TripAdvisor user
611756724.reviewBody: Museo de la cultura Maya is one of my favorite attractions in Chetumal and for my kids. We come here very often and somehow manage to learn something new each time. As my kids age I enjoy taking them back as they always marvel at something new they learned. The digital assistants are a bonus and I always enjoy trying my Mayan Math skills I learned in School. The museum is well catered and provides a wonderful historic passage of the Mayan World. You wont be disappointed!

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

591550986.name: NOT LARGE, BUT GOOD
591550986.author: a TripAdvisor user
591550986.reviewBody: You can see this in about an hour. It\'s not a big place, but it is laid out so as to give visitors a good overview of the Mayan world as viewed by the Mayans themselves.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

590306657.name: Great museum
590306657.author: a TripAdvisor user
590306657.reviewBody: This was our second visit to this museum.  I like it.  It is small compared to other museums but it is very interesting and informative.  It is worth your time to visit if you are interested in the Mayan culture.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

584922006.name: Wonderful Attraction for All Ages!
584922006.author: a TripAdvisor user
584922006.reviewBody: There is a lot to see when you visit this Museum. First we enjoyed multiple rooms of original art work - For Free! Then we paid to tour the 3-story Maya Museum. Gorgeous original Maya art, sculptures and artifacts were displayed upon entry. You can watch video presentations, see models of Maya Villages, large Maya Sculptures, murals of daily life. My favorite part was descending into The Underworld! It was like entering into a Cenote - Don\u2019t Be Scared! The center courtyard outside includes a typical Maya Hut with explanations on its architecture. And do not miss the Book Store! It contains a delightful and very comprehensive collection of Spanish, English, and other language books on All Topics, and other Gifts and Surprises!

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

576971680.name: disappointing
576971680.author: a TripAdvisor user
576971680.reviewBody: I have been to many museums both large and small...after visiting this one my first thought was  "what a waste of money,"  The garden in the court was was nice, not wonderful and the venue lacked substance

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

572005573.name: Informative
572005573.author: a TripAdvisor user
572005573.reviewBody: Informative museum with some nice artifacts. The display is well done over a few levels and the little court yard has an nice display of art.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

568322020.name: Wonderful museum
568322020.author: a TripAdvisor user
568322020.reviewBody: This place has a wealth of artifacts from the Mayan civilization and there is also a garden set up at back which is a replica of a myan village complete with white limestone roads and a well.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

555701112.name: Great way to spend an afternoon
555701112.author: a TripAdvisor user
555701112.reviewBody: The museum is really well done, informative, and interesting. When I was there, there wasn\'t a crowd so I got to roam around freely. My only complaint is that several of the lights on the displays were out so I was unable to see or read some of the exhibits.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

551385817.name: A fun and educative museum
551385817.author: a TripAdvisor user
551385817.reviewBody: From the outside it looks like a small city museum, very unimpresive but once inside... man, that was a nice surprise. Well kept and great displays, first class. It\'s small but well put together, I will say is worth your time.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

548085610.name: Must see in Chetumal
548085610.author: a TripAdvisor user
548085610.reviewBody: Well worth an hour of your time, stop in here to learn about pre-colombian Mayan culture. An interactive screen lets you calculate numbers in the Mayan system of dots, lines, and zeros. I arrived at 9 when they opened and got in for free because the ticket girl hadn\'t yet arrived. Cool air conditioning, low lights, and soothing jungle sounds.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

518141001.name: Immersive experience
518141001.author: a TripAdvisor user
518141001.reviewBody: Really great museum that incorporates a perfect balance of information and audiovisual art, including artifacts, models, lighting, and art pieces to educate you about the rich history of this area. Don\'t miss the art exhibits that are in the buildings bordering the inner gardens. All information in Spanish and English. Right next to a great mercado.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

514026993.name: Into the Mayan jungle...
514026993.author: a TripAdvisor user
514026993.reviewBody: This is a small museum, that gives you the feel of stepping back in time, into a jungle atmosphere.  Exhibits seem to rise out of the jungle and around corners to the sounds of birds and animals, accompanied by drums and flutes.  The facility is laid out so you can visit the three levels of the belief system (underworld, life and afterlife (heaven)) and learn about Mayan culture.  It is a beautiful place and a lovely experience. Sadly, it is difficult for elders, people with disabilities and those who do not see well.  It is very dark.  The flooring has little distinction between areas and ramps are not throughout.  We did not find an elevator and the ramps were quite steep. The (formerly) interactive screens no longer work and there is little color contrast between background and lettering on signage.  If there were audio headsets, elevators and better ramps, it would help to accommodate elders and  those with impaired sight.  Still, it is quite an experience and if one member of the party can see well enough to read to others the explanations are excellent and balanced.  The garden outside is also lovely.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

505851099.name: All you need is an hour
505851099.author: a TripAdvisor user
505851099.reviewBody: A terrific little museum that attempts to conjure the Mayan past with art, sculptures and music in a jungle canopy setting. One can spend an hour here and see everything. The cost is hardly worth mentioning as it is inexpensive and it was really nice to see a few locals enjoying their  rich heritage. This museum is centrally located and wheelchair accessible. It is quite dark inside with dim lighting so be careful as you go up and down the broad marble stairs because they do not have rails. I went in the afternoon which was an enjoyable way to escape the heat and humidity of Chetumal in July.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

503401813.name: great exhibition
503401813.author: a TripAdvisor user
503401813.reviewBody: the museum is a must see in the city center - it is new and the exhibition is absolutely state of the art! So when you\'re in Chetumal - don\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

495950437.name: Best museum yet
495950437.author: a TripAdvisor user
495950437.reviewBody: Truly displays the beautiful Mayan culture. One of my favorite museums I have gone, the layout of this museum is in 3 different levels. Each one representing the 3 worlds the mayans Believed in. Not much to do in Chetumal so if you find yourself there. A must!

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

495491394.name: Really a great museum
495491394.author: a TripAdvisor user
495491394.reviewBody: \nthis is a very pleasant surprise in a dubious barrio. Well thought out displays and exhibits, exotic lighting and forest canopy effect and sound track. Good explanation of Mayan calendars. Only complaint would be that some of the information boards are positioned too low and under lighted. Must see!

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

478083368.name: Nicely presented
478083368.author: a TripAdvisor user
478083368.reviewBody: A very nicely presented exhibition, with very good explanations. However, there are not to many real Maya items in here.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

467910122.name: Best Maya Museum I have been to!
467910122.author: a TripAdvisor user
467910122.reviewBody: I honestly didn\'t expect much from this little museum, but it blew me away. We stopped there on our way from Tulum to Calakmul. The whole architecture of the museum is built according to the traditional Maya view of the universe, which was subtle and yet profound. We spent about 2 hours here, and it was just amazing. I have been studying Maya culture for years, and found the information presented in this museum to be both accurate and enlightening. They presented the culture very clearly and simply, and had great exhibits and a fantastic little bookshop. I wish I could go there again sometime soon!

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

463594216.name: The best overview of Mayan culture
463594216.author: a TripAdvisor user
463594216.reviewBody: If your travels include visits to Mayan archaeological sites, then this museum is a "must".  The minimum visit time is 2 hours.  Entrance fee is very reasonable.  The museum takes you through the pre-Mayan times up through the various periods of Mayan history.  There are dioramas of buildings, interactive displays, the signage is in both Spanish and English and well translated.  Ambiance is created with sound and light and temperature changes.  This is the best Mayan museum we have seen.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

459106051.name: Very informative
459106051.author: a TripAdvisor user
459106051.reviewBody:
For the price, 30 MXN$, this is a really amazing museum. Well laid out with lots of information about maya culture and their cities.

The museum consists of 3-floors, with wheelchair access.

The only criticism, like others have said, the lighting is quite poor.

Well worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

456685886.name: A cultural learning place
456685886.author: a TripAdvisor user
456685886.reviewBody: Our family toured this museum in January 2017. I was impressed that the signs in the museum were both English and Spanish, some were even in ketchi. This was a great help to our family to read the cultural history in English. They only take pesos. Three levels of models of Mayan ruins, Mayan culture and beliefs. Very interesting place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

456287625.name: Maya museum
456287625.author: a TripAdvisor user
456287625.reviewBody: Thoroughly enjoyed the museum, their artifacts and maya knowledge. Go see. There are 3 levels of info.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

455632444.name: Small but very informative
455632444.author: a TripAdvisor user
455632444.reviewBody: Great place to learn about the Mayan culture.   Lots of history to learn her & numerous exhibits that are very educational.   Good for all ages!  Very enjoyable!

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

451264245.name: Solid
451264245.author: a TripAdvisor user
451264245.reviewBody: This is a solid museum. There are lots of interactive exhibits. The timeline of Mayan periods and corresponding sites is super helpful. Definitely worth a visit if you\'re in Chetumal.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

450845803.name: Fabulous museum
450845803.author: a TripAdvisor user
450845803.reviewBody: One of the best Mayan museums I have seen in the Yucat\u00e1n. Nicely arranged. Lighting could be better, but it\'s only a minor inconvenience. Exhibits explained in English and Spanish. Very highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

444323310.name: An Educational Jewel
444323310.author: a TripAdvisor user
444323310.reviewBody: Despite its small size, there is much to see here.  From information about social structure, economics or mathematical system, one leaves with a solid introduction to Mayan civilization.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

444239950.name: Very fun and educational
444239950.author: a TripAdvisor user
444239950.reviewBody:
I loved the overall layout of the museum. Specifically the fact that it has three floors that represent the three realms of the universe that the ancient Mayas believed in.

Each floor had beautifully recreated and original pieces of Mayan artwork and ceramics, and the descriptions were available in both English and Spanish.

Very much worth the visit if you've never been to a Mayan museum before, and especially if you have kids.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

442738695.name: My First Mayan Musuem
442738695.author: a TripAdvisor user
442738695.reviewBody: Great introductory museum to the Mayan world, before you see any of the ruins and the huge Mayan section of the Anthropology museum in Mexico City. Most of the signage in Spanish and English. Thoroughly enjoyed the section on Mayan math system.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

410478714.name: Great Museum!
410478714.author: a TripAdvisor user
410478714.reviewBody: Centrally located and easy to find, a recommended place to see. This museum has a few original Mayan pieces, as well as replicas. It is thoughtfully laid out to give you an accurate, as well as creative, account of how the Mayans lived and what it looked like in their day. Lighting and decor takes you back to the days of the Mayans. Great museum!

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

401508614.name: Displays of Mayan history pre and post Spanish invasion
401508614.author: a TripAdvisor user
401508614.reviewBody: The visitor walks through displays and sees replicas and models with good signage in Spanish and English. Dark and air-conditioned.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

394142772.name: Interesting museum with good artefacts.
394142772.author: a TripAdvisor user
394142772.reviewBody: The museum is interesting and has lots of information which is nicely broken down. There are objects and exhibits that help to reinforce what the information is telling you.\nOne slight improvement might be to have better lighting so people can read the information more easily because in some cases even I struggled and my vision is decent.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

382462771.name: Beautiful Mayan Museum
382462771.author: a TripAdvisor user
382462771.reviewBody: This museum is a great place to visit. Very informative and educational. Lots of exhibits with artifacts and relics attractively displayed. I learned a lot about the Mayan culture here. I recommend at least two hours to see everything. Well worth your time. Go see it! \ud83d\ude03

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

374066145.name: First Time and enjoyed it!
374066145.author: a TripAdvisor user
374066145.reviewBody: Pretty Kewl if you are into Mayan History, which I am sure many folks that visit the Yucatan are.  Was hoping to see a little bit more on the Belizean Mayan History however that is not their main interest. Some of what I read did not match other sources for the same area.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

353690026.name: Great museum
353690026.author: a TripAdvisor user
353690026.reviewBody: The museum is beautifully designed. There is a lot of information about the Mayan culture and it\'s people. It is walking distance from many of the hotels. It\'s a must see when you\'re visiting.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

353368828.name: impressive
353368828.author: a TripAdvisor user
353368828.reviewBody: Big museum is one of the highlights in Chetumal! Interesting overview over Maya history. It is also worth to visit government house at the bay, where impressive murals of Mexico history can be seen. We were not lucky with Dany-manatee. He had a few days rest from the visitors in the middle of February....

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

352996505.name: Mayan history and culture museum
352996505.author: a TripAdvisor user
352996505.reviewBody:
Large museum of Mayan history and culture in downtown Cherumal - at the southern end of Yucatn peninsula.  Good overview of Mayan history and culture with many artifacts and dioramas.  Good bookstore in courtyard on the way to the clean bathrooms with ample provision for visitors.  It is dark and while it is generally accessible to wheelchairs and visitors with limited mobility - ramps to all three floors though I did not see an elevator - the signage is not always placed with wheelchair visitors in mind.  We had a guide and found his explanations helpful.  The presentation of the Mayan calendar and Mayan calculations on the base 20 were particularly helpful. 

Across the courtyard is the city covered market. We found some local handicrafts around the back as well as clothing and other items for the local people. 

Don't miss the murals in the state capital building on the waterfront or the large model of Chetumal before the reconstruction after the hurricane acrross the street from the capital building.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

349609182.name: Just a place to run through
349609182.author: a TripAdvisor user
349609182.reviewBody:
The place is dark! It is IMPOSSIBLE to read the info. The info was placed in a very un comfortable location, needed " to get down to the knees"...some of the light bulbs are missing, the screens of the multi media are 30% working. Some of the signs are on transparent glass and there are lit object with details behind it, adds to the impossible reading.

The first area was designed to go from right to left ( if it was Arabic or Hebrew it was fine...) and added to the discomfort "going against"
It looks like a lot was invested but the result is poor
Bring along a flashlight so you can read

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

349234399.name: A Little Disappointing...
349234399.author: a TripAdvisor user
349234399.reviewBody: The museum was one of the "must see" places in Chetumal according to the visitors guide book I had.  My wife and I have been to a lot of Mayan sites in Mexico, so we both were looking forward to visiting the museum.  I think the problem for us was we had been to a lot of Mayan sites and visited many small museums and enjoyed the displays at those sites.  Unfortunately, this museum didn\'t offer much in comparison to the places we\'ve been.  I do think it\'s worth a visit if you are in Chetumal, but depending on how much Mayan culture you\'ve been exposed to, don\'t expect too much.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

345708207.name: Fine Museum
345708207.author: a TripAdvisor user
345708207.reviewBody: Wonderful displays/artifacts demonstrating the Mayan civilization. Worth a visit if you\'re in Chetumal for day or two.   There is a fee of 76 Pesos per adult for admission. \n\n

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

344460269.name: best museum on maya culture
344460269.author: a TripAdvisor user
344460269.reviewBody: this nice museum is more or less the only sight in chetumal. good introduction to the mayan world in different periods.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

339752804.name: Wonderfully designed museum
339752804.author: a TripAdvisor user
339752804.reviewBody: I love the design of this museum.  It has a wonderful flow as you go through the levels of the Mayan World.  Many things were not working when we went.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

335479118.name: Interesting layout - short on content
335479118.author: a TripAdvisor user
335479118.reviewBody: May be best thing in town, but it falls a bit short if you expect to gain much knowledge on Maya culture and history. There are however some nice items, even if they are not original, so treat yourself to it - but manage your expectations.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

334847708.name: Weirdest museum
334847708.author: a TripAdvisor user
334847708.reviewBody: Walked into a dark, damp smelling museum with no real anything; just plastic trees and plastic and fake replicas of real things. No real substance. Supposedly it\'s the #1 thing to do in Chetumal however honestly there is nothing to do in Chetumal- avoid if you can, wouldn\'t recommend.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

330871949.name: No relics, but bilingual displays of Mayan culture
330871949.author: a TripAdvisor user
330871949.reviewBody: We not spent about 30 minutes in this well designed museum building.  We have been to man Mayan ruins abandoned nuseum displays and he didn\'t add anything but would be fine for the novice.  It was 70 pesos each. Not open on Mondays.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

327069508.name: Informative & Interesting
327069508.author: a TripAdvisor user
327069508.reviewBody: Very informative and nicely laid out, provides a good introduction to Mayan civilization which was a great platform for our tour. Items on display were copies designed to be illustrative and descriptions were in Spanish and English

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

325504820.name: Great concept, fair execution
325504820.author: a TripAdvisor user
325504820.reviewBody:
The museum is organized by the Maya symbolism of the ceiba tree; the lower level is the underworld, the main level the land of the living, and the upper level the land of the gods (okay, that might be a little Christian, but anyhow).

Within each level, especially the main level, the organization gets confusing.  For example, visitors walk over a mockup of groups of pyramids, but they are groups from all over the Maya world just plopped next to each other.  Similarly, a lot of other pieces seemed positioned for artistic effect, not for historical understanding.

One note: the city was hot and extremely humid on my visit.  The air conditioning of this large open space was only effective at the lower level.  Otherwise, I had sweat pouring off my face, and I felt a little weak.

Tip: the lower level is reached by a staircase or ramp at the back, near the monumental ceiba, not the staircase at the front of the museum.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

324536522.name: Spectacular
324536522.author: a TripAdvisor user
324536522.reviewBody: Beautiful display of Maya art that should not be missed on any visit to Chetumal.  The air conditioning was out the day I was there, but it was worth while anyway.  One caution: there are many steps to be navigated, but there are also ramps.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

318745151.name: A great little museum!
318745151.author: a TripAdvisor user
318745151.reviewBody: For a small town, Chetumal has a wonderful little museum on the Maya culture. There are interactive displays in Spanish and English and a good selection of artifacts, though I understand the best ones have been taken to other cities. The museum is in three levels representing the three worlds of the Maya. It\'s very well done.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

316722759.name: Well designed museum
316722759.author: a TripAdvisor user
316722759.reviewBody: We loved this museum of Mayan culture. The displays were informative and engaging. We thought the entrance fee was reasonable at 64 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

304441290.name: Worth a look
304441290.author: a TripAdvisor user
304441290.reviewBody: good museum - really well done and interesting for all the family. its small and would not take long to get around it.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

293101755.name: Great first taste of Mayan Culture
293101755.author: a TripAdvisor user
293101755.reviewBody: My knowledge was rather limited on the Mayan civilisation before my visit and this was a perfect first taste. There are details spanning right form the beginnings up to the arrival of the spanish. There are plenty of interactive exhibits for kids and adults alike. We were the only people here when we visisted but that didnt detract. there are tonnes of replica items and scale models of all the large mayan sites. The fee was minimal from memory and worth it. It is very modern inside and accessible to all with ramp access to all areas, other than a small "underworld" exhibit. I would recommend this place to anyone with an hour or so to spare in Chetumal.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

292991708.name: Museo de la Cultura Maya en Chetumal
292991708.author: a TripAdvisor user
292991708.reviewBody: Wonderful place to visit, well maintenance, and the place is very well displayed. Is located downtown and just next to the Tour bus station.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

290747351.name: Do not miss this museum!
290747351.author: a TripAdvisor user
290747351.reviewBody: If you\'re in Chetumal, do not miss this museum!  Excellent and comprehensive information about everything Maya in a charming facility laid out to match the Mayan worldview with the tree of life and underworld.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

289935994.name: Outstanding Museum, But Needs More Light.
289935994.author: a TripAdvisor user
289935994.reviewBody: The last time there it was being renovated (2 years ago). The result is sensational! You need a few hours to really explore it all. There is a lot of detailed written information on all the displays. So much you can learn and appreciate. The re-creations are very detailed and well done. I would have enjoyed it so much more if I could have read everything but the lighting was so dimmed that the font color and size made it impossible for me to read a lot of it. I recommend taking a pocket flashlight. There is a set of stairs in the back that lead to the underground world that was very hard to negotiate due to the poor lighting and the tiles are very slick. Still worth the visit, but they really need to do something about the lighting.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

282167047.name: MAYA CULTURE
282167047.author: a TripAdvisor user
282167047.reviewBody: More attractions needed around museum and could be brighter.Different location for these new building,next to trash dumper that was smelly food from the market across the street.They sell chicken and different meats which makes the museum look bad. Great displays inside the museum,

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

277669676.name: fascinating
277669676.author: a TripAdvisor user
277669676.reviewBody: Had read poor reviews but I found this to be an excellent museum, well laid out with English interpretations. it gives  good grounding into the Mayan cultural history

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

252500480.name: Needs maintenance
252500480.author: a TripAdvisor user
252500480.reviewBody: This museum is very nicely done, but we found it difficult to see and to read some of the things because many lights were out.  It was also rampant with mould and mildew spores and it took my system more than an hour to recover from the allergic reaction.  Be aware that the artefacts are reproductions, not the real thing.  However, it is well done and you can learn a lot about the Mayan culture.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

242493874.name: Very interesting
242493874.author: a TripAdvisor user
242493874.reviewBody: Although the vivist to the museum was cut short and we were not able to see the ruins, the exhibits within the museum are very interesting and well curated and worthwhile all on their own, I look forward to another visit so I can see it completely

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

229491668.name: A dream world.
229491668.author: a TripAdvisor user
229491668.reviewBody: I could spend an entire week inside this wonderful Museum!  The scenery was wonderful and the inside is designed for easy walking and much discussion.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

228523940.name: Mayan fans -a must visit
228523940.author: a TripAdvisor user
228523940.reviewBody: Last year my adult son and I visited this museum which came highly recommended by friends. It was an eye opener ..Just the building is worth seeing and inside was arranged like an enormous ceiba tree -the sacred  tree of the Mayans depicting the three levels from Xibalba to t he heavens. Very modern, instructive with computerized interactive sessions.A wonderful way to  spend an hour or two  revellng in Mayan history. .

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

228108790.name: Great museum
228108790.author: a TripAdvisor user
228108790.reviewBody: The museum was located not far from our hotel in a modern style building where three floors depict the various levels of heaven, earn and underworld. It is well done , clean air conditioned and the layout of the various exhibits is done tastefully and well organized. If you are visiting Chetumal, the museum is a must-see on your itinerary.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

219847789.name: Excelent!
219847789.author: a TripAdvisor user
219847789.reviewBody: This museum is really interesting.  There are games to learn about mayan culture and they are really good.  If you have an ID of student or teacher you have discount on the ticket.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

212623133.name: Well worth the time!
212623133.author: a TripAdvisor user
212623133.reviewBody: For its thoughtful design if nothing else, this museum is worth an hour or two if you are interested in maya culture.  It is split into thirds, the top being cielo, or heaven, the middle, tierra or earth, and the bottom xibalba, or the underworld.  The ceiba tree, the tree of life, stands in the middle of it all.  There are good interactive kiosks for kids (and adults!) and the displays are informative in both English and Spanish.  I particularly liked the reproduction of the murals at Bonapak as I can\'t seem to ever make it there.  I am proud of Chetumal and Mexico for providing this small but interesting glimpse into the their culture.  Only caution - it\'s dark in there.  Keep your eyes open, I slipped and almost twisted an ankle!  Be sure also to visit the book store next door - great stuff.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

207379029.name: Worth a visit
207379029.author: a TripAdvisor user
207379029.reviewBody: In Chetuamal there are not a lot of things to see, but this museum is on of them. A nice shelter from the sun as well. The museum itself is very interesting.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

201584765.name: If you\'re in Chetumal, don\'t pass this museum up!
201584765.author: a TripAdvisor user
201584765.reviewBody: This is a relatively small but highly interesting Mayan museum, with an number of interesting Mayan pieces and lots of interactive exhibits. Information is in both Spanish and English. It shouldn\'t take more than a couple of hours to see everything.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

199091588.name: Excellent museum design, good exhibits
199091588.author: a TripAdvisor user
199091588.reviewBody: The museum is fairly small, but it has a really excellent layout with engaging exhibits. It is arranged in three floors in a spiral, with a wide variety of different exhibit styles. As someone with a background in museum studies and exhibit design, I was very impressed with their use of space. The only complaint I would make about this museum is that it needs some maintenance. There are burnt-out lightbulbs on important exhibits and other minor issues that are a little distracting. The bathrooms are outside by the Mayan home exhibit. A good value for the price.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

195926059.name: Museo De La Cultura Maya a Chetumal landmark
195926059.author: a TripAdvisor user
195926059.reviewBody: Near the marcado, a modern building with some marble floors, cool A.C., and a fine collection of Maya information, best suited for people with little experience, in other words a sort of introductory museum well worth the visit. Models of the three tower structure at Xpujil, the palace at Sayil, and othe iconic structures from places such as Hochob,Chicanna, Yaxchilan, Tikal, Copan, Chichen, and Tulum. A scale model of Pacals crypt cover, as well. Basic descriptions of Maya writing, and their calender system can also be seen. An impressive copy of one of the murals at Bonampak, by Pedro Davalos is probly worth the visit alone. The basement has a  mock up of a \'sacred cave\' with figures, pottery and a sound effects system. There is also a full scale copy of the burial crypt at Copan, of the son of SmokeImixGod K from year 695. Under a thick glass floor 4 to 6 feet below there is a model of the Palace at Palenque. Out side in the courtyard (there is no need to pay for this) there is a "Mayan" hut with a fireplace, rustic furnature and a few tools. The offices in this area contain an art gallery or 2, bookstore, and a few friendly workers home offices. Very spanish little english but I always visit this place when in Chetumal,the cabs are nearby at the market and is convient to further explore this sub tropical city especially after being in the drier part of the Yucatan north.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

184271560.name: Some nice artifacts but a fairly basic museum
184271560.author: a TripAdvisor user
184271560.reviewBody: The museum is beautifully decorated to give you the feel of being in the Mayan jungle. They have some impressive statues and interesting mock-ups with explanations in English and Spanish. It is definitely worth a visit but don\'t expect national museum standards.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

178002434.name: Small But Nicely Done!
178002434.author: a TripAdvisor user
178002434.reviewBody: Let\'s face it - there is not a lot to do in Chetumal, so when I found this museum I was delighted.  I learned a lot and passed a nice hour inside in the cool ac which is great in Chetumal too.  I wouldn\'t miss this if going to Chetumal.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

177740227.name: the Mayan Museum in Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico
177740227.author: a TripAdvisor user
177740227.reviewBody: If you are interested in the Mayan culture or the history of the people, you don\'t want to miss this!\nYou\'ll see the different explanations of the Mayan kpeoples\' empire and all it had. It was truly amazing. There are several different  kinds of pots and utensils that have been excavated at many of the different Mayan ruins in this part of the area .There is a replica of the kind of housing where lived. They were very colorful people. You will see the type of clothing they wore.        \nEven if you don\'t know a thing about the Mayans, you will surely be enlightened.

address.streetAddress: Av Heroes, between Colon and Gandhi Chetumal, Quintana Roo, Mexico

644995034.name: stunning building
644995034.author: a TripAdvisor user
644995034.reviewBody: while the museum and th exhibition itself may be of limited interest, the building of the former Socialist School, built in the late 1930s, it itself the attraction. free to walk in and around. especially the outdoor stage and amphitheater are amazing.

address.streetAddress: Av de los Heroes 66 corner with Av. Heroes

623585539.name: Modern, small Spanish museum of the city
623585539.author: a TripAdvisor user
623585539.reviewBody: Firstly the museum seems to have been renovated recently, with the price matching the update. It costs 100 pesos to enter for around 45 minutes (partly as I had to translate quite a lot of the Spanish) but it was interesting to read about the Spanish invasion, pirates and modern day Chetumal and the vision for the future.

address.streetAddress: Av de los Heroes 66 corner with Av. Heroes

548068685.name: Wrong map location
548068685.author: a TripAdvisor user
548068685.reviewBody: For 17 pesos, this quaint museum gives you a complete history of Chetmaul and Quintana Roo in general. Note that the map is incorrect. The museum is located on a side street across from the Hotel Los Cocos.

address.streetAddress: Av de los Heroes 66 corner with Av. Heroes

657178937.name: This Is Your Store
657178937.author: a TripAdvisor user
657178937.reviewBody: When we are away from home (Illinois) for 4 months and I need something in Mexico, this is where I come.  They have everything.  It is the Nordstrom of Mexico.  Very trending clothes, jewelry, furniture, perfumes, kitchenware, home owners needs, books, EVERYTHING!  Even a fun candy section!
